author: Greg Stohr
description: A divided US Supreme Court cleared Texas to use a new Republican-drawn congressional map for next year’s election, bolstering GOP hopes of picking up as many as five new House seats in the state.
title: Supreme Court Lets Texas Use GOP-Drawn Voting Map for 2026

description: Former Secretary of Defense, Leon Panetta, states there are a lot of questions that need answering when weighing in on Secretary Pete Hegseth’s orders against a suspected drug-smuggling boat near Venezuela. Panetta talks about whether or not Hegseth should be removed from his role and if a war crime was committed. Panetta speaks with Joe Mathieu and Amara Omeokwe on the late edition of Bloomberg’s “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Many Questions Need Answering: Panetta on Boat Strikes

author: Nick Wadhams
description: In the high-frequency churn of President Donald Trump’s first term, Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth’s repeated missteps would have fueled guessing games about his imminent firing. In the second, he has maintained White House support — at least for now.
title: Hegseth Keeps Trump’s Favor for Now Despite Fresh Missteps

author: Maggie Eastland
description: Nvidia Corp. would be barred from shipping advanced artificial intelligence chips to China under bipartisan legislation unveiled Thursday in a bid to codify existing US restrictions on exports of advanced semiconductors to the Chinese market.
title: Senators Seek to Block Nvidia From Selling Top AI Chips to China

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK is prepared to cancel its £6.3 billion ($8.4 billion) Ajax program, Defence Secretary John Healey said, after the army halted its use of the armored vehicles built by General Dynamics UK Ltd after soldiers fell ill while riding in them.
title: UK Prepared to Cancel £6.3 Billion Ajax Program, Healey Says

author: Akshat Rathi, Danielle Bochove, Nojoud Al Mallees
description: Prime Minister Mark Carney’s move to placate Alberta with an oil pipeline deal is emboldening a resurgent separatist movement in Quebec, warned former cabinet minister Steven Guilbeault, who resigned over the agreement last week.
title: Carney’s Alberta Oil Deal Is Fueling Quebec Separatism, Ex-Minister Guilbeault Says

author: Courtney McBride
description: The Pentagon has endorsed the Aukus security agreement among the US, UK and Australia after a five-month review, according to a US lawmaker.
title: Pentagon Endorses Aukus Pact After Review, US Lawmaker Says

author: Caitlin Reilly
description: Multiple plans have been offered, but none so far have the votes to pass.
title: Congress Stumbles Toward Obamacare Deadline With No Clear Direction

description: According to the Center for Disease Control, the leading cause of death in the United States continues to be heart disease, affecting over 60 million women of all ages. Weill Cornell Medicines Women's Heart Program Director Dr. Nupoor Narula believes its important, especially for women, to participate in research studies when possible to help get a more complete picture of one's personal health. She joined Carol Massar and Alexis Christoferous on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to examine he underpinnings of heart failure in young women and improving detection of aortic aneurysms. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Cornell Women's Heart Director on Improving Detection of Aortic Aneurysms

description: Encouraging trial data is instilling both confidence and capital back into the psychedelic drug market, with estimates suggesting growth up towards $7 billion by the year 2032. One pharmaceutical company, Compass Pathways,  has begun final stage studies aimed at using psilocybin for the treatment of patients with depression. CEO Kabir Nath joined Carol Massar and Alexis Christoforous on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to discuss commercial viability for psilocybin and the future of the psychedelic drug development market. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Compass Pathways Eyes FDA Approval for Psilocybin Depression Drug

author: Laura Nahmias
description: New York City Mayor Eric Adams issued a pair of executive orders aimed at addressing antisemitism, his office said, weeks before Zohran Mamdani takes his place.
title: NYC Mayor Eric Adams Issues Order Banning Israel Divestment

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A US appeals court will allow President Donald Trump to keep thousands of National Guard troops in Washington for now, temporarily halting a district judge’s ruling that declared the deployment unlawful.
title: Trump’s DC Troop Deployment Allowed by Appeals Court for Now

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump has tapped a new architect to help plan his $300 million White House ballroom wing, assigning the former lead designer to a consultant role in the high-profile and controversial project.
title: Trump Replaces Architect to Lead $300 Million Ballroom Design

description: On today's episode of Bloomberg Businessweek Daily, Carol Massar and Alexis Christoforous discuss today's market action as stocks waver near record highs and bonds decline ahead of next week's Fed decision. Bloomberg's Stuart Paul and Ira Jersey join the show to break it down. Plus, Compass Pathways CEO Kabir Nath talks possible FDA approval for the company's psilocybin depression drug and the path to commercial viability, and Weill Cornell Medicine Women's Heart Program Director Dr. Nupoor Narula examines the underpinnings of heart failure in young women and improving detection of aortic aneurysms. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Stocks Waver as Traders Await Fed | Bloomberg Businessweek Daily 12/4/2025

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Beatriz Reis
description: Brazil’s economic team will be able to exclude 10 billion reais ($1.8 billion) from next year’s fiscal target as part of a plan to help the country’s postal service that’s facing a serious financial crisis.
title: Brazil Aims to Exclude Aid for Postal Service from Fiscal Rules

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: The US imposed a $7 million penalty on a New York property-management firm for breaking sanctions against Russian oligarch Oleg Deripaska several years ago.
title: US Fines NY Firm for Breaking Sanctions Against Russian Oligarch

description: Republican Representative from Indiana Marlin Stutzman says that it would be 'tough' for him to support an extension of Affordable Care Act subsidies into 2026, even as some of his moderate colleagues reach across the aisle to work with Democrats on a solution. Stutzman also weighed in on party infighting between Congresswoman Elise Stefanik and House Speaker Mike Johnson, saying that Republicans should keep criticism 'inside the family.'  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: House Republicans Face Infighting, Retirements As Funding Fights Continue

author: Hadriana Lowenkron, Andrew Kreighbaum
description: President Donald Trump’s administration restricted employment authorization for asylum seekers and other immigrants, the latest bid to increase scrutiny of migrants entering the country.
title: Trump Restricts Migrant Work Permits in Immigration Crackdown

description: Applications for US unemployment benefits fell last week to the lowest in more than three years, indicating that employers are still largely holding onto workers despite a wave of recent layoff announcements. The low-hire, low-fire job market has kept a lid on initial applications for unemployment benefits, but it has also limited out-of-work Americans’ ability to find a new job. This comes as Federal Reserve officials will decide whether to lower interest rates for a third-straight meeting next week. Bloomberg's Ira Jersey and Stuart Paul joined Carol Massar and Tim Stenovec on 'Bloomberg Businessweek Daily' to break it down. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Jobless Claims Fall to Three-Year Low Ahead of Pivotal December Fed Meeting

author: Fabiola Zerpa
description: Chevron Corp. is flying employees from Caracas to its oil production sites in Venezuela despite a US warning to operators that air travel in the region may be unsafe due to military satellite interference.
title: Chevron Flies Venezuela Staff to Oil Sites Despite FAA Warning

description: On the early edition of Balance of Power, Bloomberg Washington Correspondent Joe Mathieu discusses the Pentagon watchdog's report of Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth use of Signal. On today's show, McCain Institute Executive Director Evelyn Farkas, Stonecourt Capital Partner Rick Davis, Arc Initiatives Partner Jonae Wartel and Republican Congressman Marlin Stutzman of Indiana. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Watchdog Report Intensifies Hegseth Scrutiny | Balance of Power: Early Edition 12/4/2025

description: Bloomberg Pentagon reporter Tony Capaccio breaks down the inspector general's report into whether Department of Defense chief Pete Hegseth revealed unclassified information in a unsecured signal chat. The newly released report revealed that while Hegseth had the status to declassify the information, he risked endangering troops by revealing the details.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Watchdog Says Hegseth Signal Chat Exposed Details, Risked Troops Safety

author: Erik Wasson, Roxana Tiron, Jamie Tarabay
description: The US admiral whose strikes on an alleged drug-running boat have drawn bipartisan scrutiny and prompted accusations of possible war crimes told lawmakers on Thursday he was not ordered to kill everyone on board.
title: Admiral Denies ‘Kill All’ Order in Boat Strike, Lawmakers Say

description: Former Defense Department official Evelyn Farkas said the legal justification for US military strikes against suspected drug-smuggling boats is questionable, and those involved could face consequences down the road.  (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Legal Questions Linger as Admiral at Center of Boat Strike Briefs Lawmakers

author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: President Donald Trump gathered the leaders of Rwanda and the Democratic Republic of Congo to sign a peace accord and economic agreements with the US, though it’s unclear whether the efforts will resolve a 30-year conflict that continues to fester.
title: Trump Lands Congo-Rwanda Peace Agreement With Impact Unclear

author: David Feliba
description: Argentine President Javier Milei had planned to go to Washington this week for Donald Trump’s big World Cup event. Then he abruptly canceled, in part because of a brewing football controversy at home.
title: Milei Exposes Local Football Rift by Skipping Trump’s World Cup Show

description: Trump’s political superpower used to be detecting the public zeitgeist. His 36% approval rating means that’s no longer the case, Nia-Malika Henderson says. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Trump Doesn’t Know What Americans Want Anymore

author: Andrey Lemeshko
description: Russia banned Snap Inc.’s Snapchat and Apple Inc.’s FaceTime, further limiting access to Western communication services, according to Interfax.
title: Russia Bans Snapchat, FaceTime, Report Says

description:
Novelist Salman Rushdie tells Mishal Husain that book bans in the US are an attempt to "erase" diverse perspectives on American history.

Subscribe to The Mishal Husain Show wherever you get your podcasts. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Salman Rushdie Warns Against US Book Bans

description: Novelist Salman Rushdie tells Bloomberg that the banning of books in the US which “tell the story of America from a different viewpoint” is “clearly an attempt to erase that viewpoint.” PEN America, an advocacy group, has documented nearly 23,000 book bans in US public schools since 2021, which it said is “without precedent.” Speaking on The Mishal Husain Show, Rushdie said that one of the reasons he moved to the US in 2000 was because free speech is enshrined in its Constitution through the Fir
title: Salman Rushdie Says US Book Bans Are ‘Dangerous’

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth exposed sensitive information when he sent details of a pending military strike via a Signal chat on his personal phone, the Pentagon inspector general found.
title: Hegseth’s Texts Exposed Sensitive Details on Yemen Strike

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: A government watchdog is investigating whether Federal Housing Finance Agency Director Bill Pulte abused his position to level allegations of mortgage fraud at President Donald Trump’s perceived political opponents.
title: Pulte Faces Federal Watchdog’s Probe After His Fraud Accusations

author: Peter Blumberg
description: In a report filed to Congress on Dec. 3, the acting Pentagon inspector general concluded that sensitive messages Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth sent in a group Signal chat months prior risked putting US troops in danger, a person familiar with the matter said.
title: Why Report Finds Hegseth’s Use of Signal Risked Putting US Troops in Danger

author: Caitlin Reilly, Erik Wasson
description: A band of House Republicans joined several Democrats on Thursday to support a compromise plan to renew expiring health care subsidies amid fears from some swing-district GOP lawmakers an impending spike in insurance premiums will trigger a public backlash.
title: Moderate Republicans Defy House Leaders in Health Subsidy Bid

author: Cory Bennett, Monica Raymunt
description: The European Union is reviewing tariffs on an electric SUV that Volkswagen AG produces in China, raising the prospect of relief for the German automaker from the bloc’s heightened levies.
title: EU Reviews Tariffs on Volkswagen’s Made-in-China Electric SUV

description: National Economic Council Director Kevin Hassett said he told President Donald Trump he would accept the nomination to replace Jerome Powell as Fed chair if the job was offered, adding that he would prefer a larger interest-rate cut when policymakers meet in December. He also discussed the negative impact of the recent government shutdown on GDP and the administration's strong legal standing on tariffs. Hassett appears on this week's episode of "The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations." This was recorded November 12 at the Economic Club of Washington DC. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: David Rubenstein Show: Kevin Hassett

author: Helen Nyambura
description: The US will give Kenya $1.6 billion for health programs over five years, the first such bilateral deal with an African country that aims to reduce aid.
title: US Signs $1.6 Billion Kenya Health Deal as It Phases Out Aid

author: William Shaw
description: Reform UK has opened an account with Lloyds Banking Group Plc, another sign that the party is moving into the mainstream just two years after Nigel Farage said his personal bank account was closed because of his political views.
title: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK Party Opens Bank Account With Lloyds

description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says his company cannot “degrade chips” that it sells to China and that he doesn’t know if China will accept H200 chips. Huang visited lawmakers on Capitol Hill yesterday. Bloomberg's Ed Ludlow reports. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Nvidia Can't Degrade Chips That Go to China, Huang Says

author: Carolina Millan, Michael O'Boyle
description: Mexico President Claudia Sheinbaum said she will hold a short in-person meeting with Donald Trump this week in Washington, as they continue to negotiate over US tariffs on her nation’s goods.
title: Trump, Sheinbaum to Meet for First Time at World Cup Draw

author: Erik Larson
description: The Trump administration has unveiled plans to remove legal immigrants from the US, including by canceling green cards and “denaturalizing” some US citizens, after an Afghan national who entered the country in 2021 was accused of shooting two members of the West Virginia National Guard.
title: Trump Vows to Remove US Citizens. Can He Do That?

author: Zoltan Simon
description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s lawmakers have filed a bill that would make it harder for parliament to remove the country’s president from office.
title: Orban’s Lawmakers Move to Insulate Presidency Before Elections

author: Peter Martin
description: The US is “comprehensively reviewing” its relationship with Tanzania because of concerns about a crackdown on religious freedom and free speech.
title: US Reviews Tanzania Relationship After Deadly Election Crackdown

author: Matthew Bristow
description: Donald Trump’s favored candidate, Nasry Asfura, regained his lead in Honduras’ presidential vote count, edging ahead of a rival the US leader attacked as a “borderline communist.”
title: Trump-Backed Candidate Asfura Retakes Lead in Honduras Vote

author: Katy O'Donnell
description: Arizona Senator Ruben Gallego wants to use an employment-based visa program to draw more foreign investment into the US housing market, the latest proposal from Washington aimed at easing an affordability crunch caused by years of underbuilding and higher mortgage rates.
title: Senator Seeks to Tap Foreign Visa Program to Ease Housing Costs

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: President Vladimir Putin arrived in New Delhi for his first state visit to India since Russia’s full-scale invasion of Ukraine, showcasing warming ties that have angered the US and led to hefty trade tariffs.
title: Modi Rolls Out the Red Carpet for Putin in State Visit to India

author: Lucy White, Harry Wilson
description: Affiliates of Nigel Farage’s Reform UK are preparing to launch a business lobby group, as the upstart political party tries to match its lofty poll ratings with credibility around governance.
title: Farage Supporters Set to Launch New Lobby Group for Business

author: James Woolcock
description: Opposition parties rounded on UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer’s UK government, accusing ministers of “running scared” after postponing four elections for newly created mayor posts.
title: UK Opposition Parties Slam Labour Over Delays to Mayoral Votes

author: Isabella Ward
description: UK-based investors pulled out £3 billion from equities in November, with outflows nearly every day ahead of Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’s budget, before starting to buy stocks again when the measures weren’t as bad as feared.
title: UK Investors Pulled £3 Billion From Funds Ahead of Reeves Budget

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz postponed a planned trip to Oslo Friday and will instead travel to Brussels for talks with Belgian Prime Minister Bart De Wever and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen.
title: Merz to Meet Belgian Premier Amid EU Dispute Over Russian Assets

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary will raise minimum wages by a double digit margin next year as Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government struggles to give momentum to a stagnant economy before elections next year.
title: Orban Plans Double-Digit Minimum Wage Hike in Pre-Election Boost

author: Jessica Nix
description: An influential panel of US vaccine advisers is expected to reverse a longstanding recommendation that babies receive hepatitis B shots within 24 hours of birth, a change public health experts say is all but certain to endanger children.
title: US Vaccine Panel Poised to Delay Hepatitis B Shots for Newborns

author: Josh Xiao
description: Britain, France and Germany are among nations looking to seize the moment and improve ties with Beijing.
title: Trump-Xi Truce Prompts New Overtures by US Allies to China

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Ukrainian negotiators will join a new round of talks in Florida as Russian President Vladimir Putin said some of the points in a US-backed peace plan were unacceptable to him, the latest sign an agreement likely remains distant.
title: Ukrainian Envoys Head to US as Putin Rejects Parts of Peace Plan

author: Selcan Hacaoglu
description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s top political ally accused the US ambassador in Ankara of overstepping his authority by suggesting Turkey could reopen a Greek Orthodox seminary next year.
title: Erdogan’s Top Ally Rebukes US Ambassador Over Greek Seminary

author: James Woolcock
description: Nigel Farage’s Reform UK raked in more donations that any other British political party in the third quarter, boosted by a record £9 million ($12 million) gift from crypto investor Christopher Harborne, in a sign business and the wealthy are taking the party’s polling lead seriously.
title: Record Gift Helps Reform UK Close Funds Gap With Tories, Labour

description:
Bloomberg Daybreak Europe is your essential morning viewing to stay ahead. Live from London, we set the agenda for your day, catching you up with overnight markets news from the US and Asia. And we'll tell you what matters for investors in Europe, giving you insight before trading begins.

On today's show, Presidents Emmanuel Macron and Xi Jinping are meeting in Beijing as part of a three-day visit for the French leader. The pair are expected to discuss a range of issues from economics and trade, to Taiwan and the war in Ukraine.

US President Donald Trump says a meeting between his envoy Steve Witkoff and Vladimir Putin was "reasonably good". But the President acknowledged he doesn't know what the outcome will be after successive rounds of talks over a deal to end the fighting in Ukraine.

Today's guests: Joyce Chang, JP Morgan Global Research Chair & Glen Gowers, Co-founder and CEO of Basecamp Research. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Macron Meets Xi Jinping, Signs Deals in Beijing | Daybreak Europe 12/4/2025

author: Milda Seputyte
description: Lithuanian court found the leader of a junior party in the ruling coalition guilty of inciting hatred with antisemitic remarks on social media.
title: Lithuanian Court Finds Coalition Partner Guilty of Antisemitism

author: Erica Yokoyama, Takashi Umekawa, Masaru Aoki
description: Key members of Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s government wouldn’t try to stop the Bank of Japan if it decides to raise interest rates in December, according to people familiar with the matter, a stance that makes a move more likely.
title: Key Japan Officials Would Go Along With a BOJ December Rate Hike

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: India will pay about $2 billion to lease a nuclear-powered submarine from Russia, according to people familiar with the matter, finalizing delivery of the vessel after roughly a decade of talks just as President Vladimir Putin makes a visit to New Delhi this week.
title: India Clinches $2 Billion Russia Submarine Deal as Putin Visits

author: Kirsi Heikel
description: Finland pursued decades of unjust assimilation practices against the indigenous Sami people inhabiting the northernmost parts of the country, according to a Truth and Reconciliation Commission that investigated past wrongdoings.
title: Finland Committed Decades of Injustices Against Indigenous Sami People

description: President Donald Trump said a meeting between his envoy Steve Witkoff and Russian President Vladimir Putin was “reasonably good” but acknowledged he doesn’t know what the outcome will be over a deal to end the fighting in Ukraine. “What comes out of that meeting? I can’t tell you, because it does take two to tango,” Trump told reporters in the Oval Office on Wednesday. Bloomberg’s Greg Sullivan reports.
title: Trump Says Next Step After Putin-Witkoff Meeting Unclear

author: Laura Avetisyan, Sofia Horta e Costa
description: The UK government will struggle to fund spending, helping drive the yield on 30-year gilts to 6% in the coming year, according to David Zahn, head of European fixed income at Franklin Templeton.
title: Franklin Templeton Sees 6% UK Yields, Warns of Budget Reckoning

author: John Harney
description: The State Department has renamed the US Institute of Peace for President Donald Trump, whose administration tried to dismantle the organization earlier this year.
title: State Department Renames US Institute of Peace for Trump

author: Andreina Itriago, Oscar Medina
description: Cada vez más legisladores del país sudamericano visitan Pekín en lugar de Washington, mientras Trump y Petro intercambian pullas.
title: Élite política colombiana se abre a China de cara a las elecciones presidenciales

author: Andreina Itriago, Oscar Medina
description: More and more lawmakers from the South American nation are visiting Beijing instead of Washington as Trump and Petro trade barbs.
title: Colombia’s Political Elite Is Embracing China Ahead of Elections

author: Philip Aldrick
description: It’s become one of the most sensitive non-political appointments in the UK: Who is going to take over at the Office for Budget Responsibility?
title: Here’s Who May Lead the UK Budget Watchdog After Report Blunder

author: Prinesha Naidoo, Antony Sguazzin
description: Rebuilding McKinsey & Co.’s reputation in South Africa after it was implicated in state corruption scandals will be a long process, its top executives in Africa said, adding that the consulting firm is biding its time on resuming bidding for government work.
title: McKinsey Says Recovery From South Africa Scandals to Take Years

author: Arne Delfs
description: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s unwieldy ruling alliance with the Social Democrats is facing an existential crisis of its own making that could trigger its demise after only seven months in office.
title: Merz in Danger With Business Warning Germany Is in ‘Free Fall’

author: Hallie Gu, Chris Anstey
description: China is on pace to meet its pledge to buy 12 million tons of US soybeans by the end of February, US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said on Wednesday, appearing to extend an earlier deadline for Beijing’s purchases.
title: Bessent Says China ‘in a Perfect Cadence’ to Meet Soy Target

author: Michael Heath
description: Australia’s acting Prime Minister Richard Marles said the center-left Labor government has received the Pentagon’s review of the Aukus accord and the US is standing behind the pact.
title: US ‘Completely Supportive’ of Aukus, Australia’s Marles Says

author: Kok Leong Chan
description: A Malaysian court charged Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s former aide on Thursday with accepting bribes to help several firms obtain mineral exploration licenses in the Borneo state of Sabah.
title: Malaysian Premier Anwar’s Former Aide Charged With Corruption

author: Ania Nussbaum, Colum Murphy
description: French President Emmanuel Macron and Chinese leader Xi Jinping met in Beijing on Thursday, where they are set to discuss a range of issues including economic ties, trade tensions, Taiwan and the war in Ukraine.
title: Macron and Xi Meet in Beijing to Discuss Trade Tensions, Taiwan

author: Derek Wallbank, Nick Wadhams
description: The Trump administration will increase vetting of applicants for H-1B visas, with a specific instruction to reject anyone who was involved in “censorship” of free speech.
title: US to Increase H-1B Vetting Over Speech ‘Censorship’ Concerns

author: Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japanese Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi reiterated the country’s long-held position that it understands and respects China’s view that Taiwan is an “inalienable part of its territory,” without specifically agreeing to the ‘One China’ principle.
title: Takaichi Repeats 1972 Stance Respecting China’s View on Taiwan

author: Josh Sisco
description: President Donald Trump pardoned longtime sports and entertainment executive Tim Leiweke after he was criminally charged in July with bid-rigging related to the development of an arena at the University of Texas.
title: Ex-Oak View CEO Leiweke Pardoned by Trump in Bid-Rigging Case

author: Eric Martin
description: The US is inviting Poland to the next Group of 20 summit — and plans to shun South Africa — when President Donald Trump hosts the forum of the largest global economies in 2026, Secretary of State Marco Rubio said.
title: Poland to Join US-Hosted G-20 Summit as South Africa Is Shunned

description: "Balance of Power: Late Edition" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On today's show, S-3 Group Partner and Republican Strategist Ashley Davis, Sen. Gary Peters (D) Michigan, Senate Judiciary Committee Ranking Member Sen. Dick Durbin  (D) Illinois. (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Questions Regarding 2nd Boat Strike | Balance of Power: Late Edition 12/3/2025

author: Patricia Garip, Eric Martin
description: Joesley Batista, co-owner of a sprawling business empire led by the meat-processing giant JBS NV, is quietly positioning himself as a connector trying to defuse political tensions between the Trump administration and Venezuela’s ruling regime.
title: Brazil Billionaire Flew to Venezuela to Urge Maduro to Step Down

description: Senator Dick Durbin (D) Illinois, Senate Judiciary Committee Ranking Member, and Senate Appropriations Committee Member speaks with Joe Mathieu and Amara Omeokwe on “Balance of Power.” (Source: Bloomberg)
title: Can’t Keep Up With Trump Pardon Chaos: Sen. Durbin

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK government appears poised to approve China’s plan for a massive new embassy in London, as Prime Minister Keir Starmer looks to put spying fears aside and revive his plans for a diplomatic reset with Beijing.
title: Starmer Pushes Ahead With China Reset Despite Spying Fears

author: Laura Noonan
description: The European Union is in danger of striking an “unduly conservative compromise” on legislation meant to kick-start securitization, two of the bloc’s biggest finance lobbies have warned as they urge politicians to walk-back proposed changes to the package.
title: Banks Warn EU Against ‘Unduly Conservative’ Securitization Deal
